title: Need Help!!!!
body: Really want to improve, and its quite hard in bronze to do that. Highest rank is S3 (though have only been playing since late november of last year). If anyone good is willing to help me, or if anyone is in the same boat and wants to get out hit me up. IGN: Wackman.

replies.body:
If you mean it hard to improve in bronze cause there is no one to learn from then yes. But if you think as it is now and you get up to gold+ you gonna do well, then u are sadly mistaken. You will get destroy in lane and out rotated. Trolls, afk, exsit in every elo bracket. But if you dont belong in that tier you will climb out easy. At bronze it not your team, its not afk, trolls that held you back. Its you.

You are not at challenger tier where team work is more depended on. You are at bronze where people cant even cs right, use their skills right, build bad items have very little understanding on match up and start throwing insult if their laner die more than 1. Hit me up in game if you want tips.

Cheers. Yeah I know I would get destroyed, I'm not looking to be in gold because of somebody getting me there, but somebody helping me get myself there. I just need help on scenario builds, decision making, and also constructive criticism on my mechanics. I will hit you up asap.

Because you constantly play with feeders, and trolls. Plus, I don't play hyper-carry champs. 
I know you get the same amount approx. of trolls and toxicity as you go up, but its a fact in everything that if you go at a higher standard you improve far more than at a lower standard. Maybe I should have said "harder". :)

a) why don't you play hyper carrys?
b) Because feeders and trolls are at all levels that means nothing to your overall point.
c) being at a higher/lower standard doesn't matter, the difference is do you want to improve or not?

It's really not hard to improve if you actually take a step back and look at your mechanics etc. but you have to want to.

Looking at your ranked past, your deaths are too high a majority of games, your CSing is disgusting, and you need to learn to build to the game (there is an udyr game (hyper carry?) where you have full armor and health built, against a 29/3 nidalee.)

a) Because I'm new I haven't bought any hyper-carry champs. Which should i get asap??
b) Agree hundred percent.
c) I have had someone to help me. They begun teaching me but gave up the game. So, i know basic things like stances in landing, kiting, and attack move. But as you'd assume I'm not very good at them.
d) I'm really new to the game, as such don't know scenario building.
e) I have just started playing udyr in ranked, won't do so until I work a bit more in normals with him.
f) CS'ing is terrible I agree. Really gotta work on last hitting. I mean i am getting to the point when i'm at around 7 cs/min with Cho, which is better than my other landes.
G) I really do want to get better. Sure, I don't mind if i'm winning, i just want to improve. I've been working for the last two months on all of these things (after my coach stopped playing), but i got frustrated with the game, and kind of threw the focus on mechanics out the window. But last two games I've been back on it. But really do want to improve.

>f) CS'ing is terrible I agree. Really gotta work on last hitting. I mean i am getting to the point when i'm at around 7 cs/min with Cho, which is better than my other landes.

Go into a custom, pick a really shitty CSer (Vlad, Anivia, Annie) go no runes and masterys, and try to freeze lane and get all minions, go to 10:30, that minion wave your about to kill, has gotten to 114 CS

And as a note, 7 cs a minute on a champ where it's relatively hard to miss CS isn't that good

http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=Chief+Raydere

This guy is challenger, an ADC main, and averages about 8 CS a minute.

>a) Because I'm new I haven't bought any hyper-carry champs. Which should i get asap??

Better question, what mechanics are you actually good at?

Pick champs that suit those mechanics.

Also quit playing support, getting your sightstone, and not changing to sweeper.

1. Ok, will do.
2. I'm just saying 7 cs/minute is an improvement. And i want to improve substantially more.
3. I don't know what I'm good at in terms of mechanics, don't know what counts as "mechanics", but as a general assessment, probably not many.
4. Never knew that. Will do.

>and its quite hard in bronze to do that

How is it hard to improve in bronze?
